subject: Error while trying to run JUnit as a jar in Unix console
msgSnippet: Hi I have a jar file containing the TestSuite class and a main class RunTest calling TestSuite for executing all my Junit test cases. I call it in either of
messageBody:
Hi
I have a jar file containing the TestSuite class and a main
class RunTest calling TestSuite for executing all my Junit test cases.
I call it in either of the 2 ways

public class RunTest {

/**
* @param args
* @since
* @see
*/
public static void main(String[] args) {
//org.junit.runner.JUnitCore.main("com.
[...].TestSuite");
org.junit.runner.JUnitCore.runClasses(com.
[...].TestSuite.class);
}

}

Now this runs fine when I use an IDE like eclipse to run these tests.
But I want to run it in UNIX environment as a cron job.
When I try running the jar using the below command I get the error
below :-

java -jar mytest.jar RunTest

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:
org/junit/runner/JUnitCore
at com.[...].RunTest.main(RunTest.java:12)
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException:
org.junit.runner.JUnitCore
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:200)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:188)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306)
at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass
(Launcher.java:276)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:251)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal
(ClassLoader.java:319)
... 1 more

I have JUnit-4.4.jar in my PATH variable on unix.

Looking forward to hear from you. Also is there a way I could have
directly executed the TestSuite as a jar in unix without writing a
main method (RunTest.java class)?

Thanks
Vipin
